page.title: 01North Lough Beg & Environs
page.content: The predominant feature is the north part of Lough Beg from which flows the Lower Bann. It is an area of marsh and bogland with permanent pasture and some woodland. In the west there is number of low irregular hills divided from each other by small streams and bogland. A considerable number of small farms, owner occupied, of from 15-40 acres is to be found here. The houses are modern and are grouped in irregular clusters.The same arrangemet is to be found on the rising ground to the east. To the east of the Lough is the walled demesne of Ballyscullion House. To the north of the Lough is the picnic and amenity area known as the New Ferry, a popular place for water skiing. Nearby is the Culbane Peat works which processes peat for sale.
